name: Amphibian and Reptile Conservation Trust
legal: Charity.  Reg Charity no. England and Wales: 1130188 Scotland: SCO44097
goal: To further the conservation of amphibians and reptiles and the habitats on which they depend, and to further the understanding and appreciation of these species.  We do this through managing nature reserves and other habitats, providing advice, undertaking science and surveillance programmes, public awareness and advocacy.  While many of our activities are focused on the UK we also work in other nations and at European and international scales.  We actively work with other European herpetological conservation bodies including the Societas Europaea Herpetologica's Conservation Committee.
interests: Agriculture, Climate Action, Environment, Research and innovation
euInitiatives: Our focus is on European policy and legislative instruments that impact upon the natural environment and biodiversity; while most notably the Habitats Directive, Water Framework Directive and Environmental Liability Directive - we are also engaged with land use planning issues such as No nett loss and Green Infrastructure.  Agriculture and agrienvironment funding (CAP) are significant areas of interest.  In a policy context the European biodiversity strategy (and relationship to international biodiversity conventions, e.g Convention on Biological Diversity and Bern Convention) are of key interest as are specific initiatives relating to the implementation of Directives, such as monitoring and surveillance activities at a European level.
